inn1.comm: good length ball, just a little outside off and Finch stays back and punches it through cover to get off the mark right away
Hughes is on the back foot too, even if this was a lot fuller. Still angled at the two slips lying in wait though as the batsman blocks it
hint of inward movement to that full length ball on middle, which makes the bat turn in Hughes' hand as he looks to push it down to mid-on
tucked away off his pads as square leg comes into play. Bhuvi holds this one a little back and Hughes was quite comfortable on the back foot
width and smashed. it was not quite a half-volley but with that much room to free the arms and with Hughes' strength square of the wicket, that ball was going nowhere other than the point boundary
fuller again and this could have been crashed for four too, if not for mid-off running around and diving to stop it. Hughes is consciously going forward here
and he starts off with a shortish ball that pushes Hughes back as he blocks it down to his feet

back of a length and way wide of off. Finch still tries his best to reach it, but is unsuccessful. The keeper can't collect it cleanly either as the batsmen take a single along with the wide called by the umpire
picked off his hips as he moves back and across to meet the shortish ball and nudge it to fine leg
guided to third man, as he sways back and late cuts the back of a length ball aimed outside off stump
homes in on the stumps and he explores a fuller length too. Hughes covers the line and brings down a straight bat
flicked with soft hands to the left of midwicket, who runs around and collects the ball with some energy. The leaner, fitter Yuvraj in play there
keeps it nice and tight on the stumps and Hughes meets the full length ball from the crease as he blocks

Bhuvi continues to give the batsman ample room outside off. The length was good enough, but he needs to bowl that on off stump. Finch has no troule lofting this over the head of cover to kickstart his boundary count today
goes tighter immediately and Finch with no room on hand, manouvres the ball into midwicket region
a little back of a length, but it is on middle which means Finch is happy to punch it back down the pitch
Finch is getting some straight-bat practice here, which is much better for India's cause. Bhuvi bowls it short of a length and the batsman punches it straight down the ground
Much fuller this time and homes in on middle stump as Finch pushes this back to the bowler
that's his steady length, pushing the batsman on the back foot, who tucks the ball angled on leg stump to midwicket
still on a leg stump line to Hughes, who shuffles across and gets hit on his thigh pad as the ball dribbles away,
short of a length on middle and leg and Hughes works it off his pads to midwicket.
goes on the bounce to leg slip. Ishant's line is keeping him in play and so is Hughes' tactic to shuffle across and nudge it into the leg side. Raina's throw comes at Hughes, who deftly bats it away
fuller ball on middle and leg as the batsman works it to midwicket
and there's the change-up. This one just outside off stump but Hughes was going for the expansive drive, but only managed a bottom edge which goes to the keeper
No leg slip to the right-hander, but Bhuvi strays on his pads. Finch is happy to flick it fine off his pads and has enough power in the stroke to beat deep fine leg
punched down the ground and it beats Bhuvi's dive for mid-on to come round and collect. This was fuller in length, but Finch prefers to stay back
the sound off the bat is quite loud. This was back of a length with just a little room outside off. Finch goes back and pushes the ball into the covers
absolutely no room there as Finch is forced to get up tall and block the back of a length ball back to the bowler
and there's another example of the forearm strength he has. It was just a push, but the sound off the bat was crisp and the ball raced away wide of mid-off
shifts his weight forward and presents a straight bat as the good length ball is driven into cover
short ball, going up around chest-high but Hughes is comfortably in line and defends it at his feet with soft hands
and soft hands gives profit this time. Defends the good length ball on square on the off side and races off for a single
good short ball from Ishant. Got this around chest-high, but with Ishant's pace - in the early 130s - Finch has time enough to adjust, roll his wrists and hook it to the man at deep fine leg
short of a length again, as Hughes gets in line and defends off the back foot
cleverly played. Waited for the ball to come to him and it had almost passed him when he dabbed it fine. Bhuvi rushes around from square third man and pulls out a full length dive to save the four.
inside edge as Hughes prods forward and hopes to drive. He had moved a little too far across to enable that shot to get any timing as the ball deflects off his pad and goes away tamely down the pitch
he's on the off stump corridor, on the shortish side which allows Finch to go back and defend
he goes across to the off stump and nudges it straight of midwicket. It was a length ball and having hit the gap the batsmen collect the single
flicks off his pad as the fuller length ball is pushed through midwicket
this time his line is back around the off stump, which makes the batsman invest in the straight bat. Defends down the ground
on the pads again, but it doesn't cost him considering the field is set there. Hughes' clip off the pads only reaches as far as midwicket
short and a little width offered, but Finch's cut though powerful is not placed well enough to beat point
fuller and a lot more tighter on off stump which forces Finch to come forward and block it back to Ishant
goes off the outside half of the bat as ishant homes in on top of off stump. Finch was looking to block it, but tried angling the face of the bat on impact

short ball at 136 kph, but it did not rise high enough to trouble the batsman. Finch dragged it from outside off, rolled his wrists once again to keep it down and slammed it through midwicket for a powerful four
chops the good length ball outside off straight to point, and he looked disappointed with his effort
this time he waits for it a little more and beats point, but third man being quite square proves handy. Ishant continues to keep it shortish and wide outside off.
bowls back of a length, but on a tight middle stump line. Finch goes across to his off stump and nudges it to Ashwin at short midwicket
punches the good length ball on off stump down the ground. Bhuvi pulls out another dive, which goes in vain as long-off comes up to do the formalities
and to the left hander, he strays on the pads. India have struggled to keep up a steady line. Hughes happily picks it off to deep fine leg to camp at the non-strikers'
another strong back foot punch from Finch as Bhuvi keeps it shortish and outside off
this time he whips the back of a length ball from outside off stump, and places it to the right of the man at short midwicket
fuller length on middle but Hughes remains back on the crease as he pushes it down the ground
a little in dip there, but easily negotiated as Finch calmly tucks it behind square to deep fine leg off the back foot to collect a couple

dropped. Short and wide and Finch goes for the full blooded cut. It didn't look as well timed as his back foot punches and it was also hit in the air. Yuvraj, at point, leaps full length to his left and gets both hands to it as the ball dips on him, but it pops out
flicked off his pads as Ishant angles a full length ball on leg stump. The ball is timed sweetly through square leg
and there's evidence of how well he is punching the ball. Stands up as tall as he can get and smacks it straight of the man at mid-off who can only escort it to the boundary
that one jags back in to beat Finch's cut shot. It was back of a length, but not too wide outside off to merit the shot
better from Finch as he gets back in line behind the ball pitched outside off and on a shortish length and pushes it to mid-off
forays down the track, but Bhuvi offers no room to exploit as Hughes pushes it down the ground to mid-on
this time he is on the pads and Highes only has to work it off to fine leg and jog a single
tiniest bit of away movement as Finch goes back and blocks the fullish ball
shortish and outside off, been a staple length today and Finch pulls out his favourite shot of the morning, punchint it to extra
and the only change up to that plan is when the bowler goes on the pads, and is easily picked away to deep fine leg

a swift spare of runs in the last couple of overs. Ishant bowls this way outside the line of leg stump and Hughes did well to reach it and even better to flick it well to the left of the man at deep fine leg
oops, that kept low! It was nowhere near full of length and Finch was justified in going back, but the ball is only around shin high and he just manages to get his bat in line
this time he is ready for the ball, in case it keeps low, and pushes it down the ground confidently

oh, that surprised him. He was coming down the track and Vinay digs this one into the middle of the pitch. Hughes is caught off guard as he hooks and the ball goes in the air to vacant square leg region. Good bowling there
explores a fuller length and he's driven quite strongly down the ground off the front foot
tries another short ball, but Finch is far more equipped to handle this one. He is still at the crease, pushes his weight ball and hooks the ball quite well to beat the man at deep square leg
this one seams back in from outside off and Finch, looking to cut, had to adjust at the last minute and chop it to point
nudged off his pads to deep square leg as the fuller length ball is picked off to deep square leg
just a tad bit slower, 124kph, and fuller as Finch flows into a front foot cover drive. But the fielder is on hand to stop it
opens the face on impact to steer this shortish ball on off stump to point
shortish ball, but FInch was coming on to the front foot and slaps it down the ground but the bowler moves across in his follow through and fields it to prevent any runs
fuller and on the off stump corridor as Finch presses forward and pushes it down to long-off
good lines here from Vinay. Full length ball on off stump which forces the batsman to meet it with a defensive bat on the front foot

oh, he finds the gap through the off side. The ball was on a similar length as the last one, but there was possibly just a hint more room. Finch stays leg side of it and meets it with a full-flowing drive that beats the diving man at short extra cover.
oh, he almost dragged that onto his stumps. It didnt have enough room for the pull shot, though it was short enough. The ball takes the bottom edge and skirts just wide of the off stump
this one pitched on middle and wasn't too short, but at Vinay's pace, it is still easy enough to rick back and pull strongly in front of square.
takes the outside half of the bat as he goes back to defend the short of a length ball on off stump
steers the back of a length ball to point off a strong back foot push
fuller length around the off stump corridor, to which Hughes stays in the crease and drives it to mid-off
fuller again this time he places it a little wide of the man at mid-off, but he comes up quickly to force both batsmen to rush back into their crease and abandon thoughts of a single
strays on the pads this time, though on a fuller length, and is clipped through square leg
fuller and homing in on middle and leg, driven down the ground to long-on
on a good length and its pushed down the ground to mid-off
shorter than usual from Bhuvi and a little bit of room too. Hughes was looking for that, but his rasping cut shot only goes as far as point
reaches his fifty with a six over deep square leg. The ball was dug in quite short, but Finch made no effort to keep it down even if there was a man patrolling the boundary. Confident strike.

Raina does the trick with the bowlers hardly looking likely to get the wicket. Finch dabbed it to the covers off the back foot and set off for a quick single, but even as he stretched out to make his ground, the throw had already broken the stumps
this time the direct hit leaks runs. Hughes tucks the ball off his hips and the square leg did well to get to the ball, but Watson was well back in his crease leaving very little need for the throw

And he gets off the mark with a four. Streaky though it was. The ball was outside off and its length ensured the cut shot was on, but the ball leaps up above where the slips would have been and goes to the fence
fullish and on middle which is blocked solidly back to the bowler
opens the face of the bat as he steers the back of a length ball outside off stump to point
not too much flight, but he comes forward and defends back to Jadeja
plods his front foot right across to the off stump and sweeps the fullish ball to deep fine leg
angled on leg stump and turns just a little, which Watson is wary of as he defends straight down the line of it
more turn for Jadeja, who flights this a little bit more and draws Watson forward. The ball beats the edge and Dhoni asks for a stumping, but there is nothing there
gets right to the pitch of this one with his reach and drives it to long-on
shuffles across to the off side again and works the ball around the deep square leg
length delivery on off, the batsman pushes it to midwicket
fuller length on off, it invited the drive and Hughes crunches it off the front foot, but straight to cover
ah, another shortish delivery on the pads and Hughes wanted to whack it to the deep square leg boundary, but doesn't get hold of it completely, ends up playing it to fine leg
he is committed to bowl short of length today, Watson defends this one back to the bowler
keeps it accurate on off stump, the batsman comes forward and defends
slightly fuller, Watson comes forward and plays a punchy drive down the ground, but Ishant at mid-off cuts it off
tossed up delivery on the stumps, the batsman turns it to deep midwicket for a single
flatter and shorter on stumps, the batsman punches it back to the bowler
slower, fuller and on the stumps, Watson comes forward and eases it to long off for a single
similar delivery now to Hughes and he pushes it to long on for another easy run
fuller delivery on the middle stump line, the batsman opens the face and plays it towards cover
again pushed to cover, slightly aerial this time, but all in control
pushed through on off stump, the batsman defends it to point
slower and a lot of turn on this one, Hughes waits and tries to cut it, but ends up scooping it towards point, not in control at all, it just drops short of the fielder
fuller delivery on off stump, Watson plays it with turn towards midwicket
now he bowls a long hop, you can't expect to give away anything less than six on those ones. Watson smashes it flat, over the deep midwicket fielder
now he pushes it along with the turn to deep midwicket for a couple
flatter this time, the batsman defends it to midwicket
waits on the back foot and chops it on straight to point
flatter and turns into the batsman, who waits and pushes it to wide long on for a couple
on the pads, it is easily flicked fine, past the leg slip fielder, for a couple of runs
there is trouble for Watson, he has run halfway down the pitch while Hughes didn't move at all after playing it to short third man. The throw was wild though, it went the midwicket
he comes down the track and gives it a mightly swipe, it goes over deep midwicket for a six to bring up the team's 100
flatter and quicker on the stumps, Watson defends it back down the pitch
another short one, Watson goes deep in the crease and flat-bats that along the ground to deep midwicket
tossed up delivery outside off, the batsman waits on the back foot and pushes it to deep cover
it was that straighter one again, on the pads though, and it's nudged fine on the leg side for a couple
there was a fielder at deep midwicket, but he could just see this fly 5 feet away from him. It was short and it was slapped hard to the boundary. Lots of short and filthy deliveries from Ashwin
now bowls a conventional delivery outside off, the batsman defends
pushed through on off, the batsman comes forward and defends
shorter this time, the batsman stays in the crease and punches it to long on
bowl it full and on the stumps, Watson comes forward and defends it to midwicket
gets one to spin from leg stump, the batsman gets a leading edge towards off as he tries to turn it to midwicket
shorter this time, allows Watson time to go back and nudge it to square leg
Hughes does the same, he goes back and clips it behind square on the leg side for a single
bowls a tossed up delivery on off, Hughes defends to point
bowls the arm ball now, Hughes stays in the crease and defends
pushed through on middle and off line, Hughes tucks it to square leg
tossed up and full, Hughes neatly tucks it to deep midwicket for a single
another short ball, these are gifts being served to Watson and it's not his birthday..it's Kallis'.. He hammers it to deep midwicket boundary
full and flighted, driven back to the bowler
tossed up and full, Hughes plays it with the spin towards midwicket for a single
quicker and fired on the pads, the batsman defends it down the pitch
only slightly short, just slightly, Watson goes deep and mows it to the same area he has been peppering in the last few overs. The fielder had no chance
fuller and straighter this time, Watson defends it down the pitch
oh he is in some mood, he just lifts this tossed up delivery over the head of the bowler. For a second Ashwin at long off was interested, but it clears him with ease
fuller on off, the batsman comes forwards and bunts it on the crease
he draws the outside edge with an arm-ball, but the slip is on the leg side, this one just runs down quickly to the boundary
tossed up delivery on the pads, he dabs it to the left of midwicket for a single
tossed up and full, Watson takes a tiny step forward and drives it firmly over extra cover.. beautifully hit
fuller and on off, the batsman tries to push it to cover, but gets an inside edge
flatter this time, the batsman stays in the crease and punches it with ease to long on
slower delivery on the pads, Hughes calmly nudges it behind square on the leg side to bring his half-century
fired on the off stump, the batsman nudges it through wide mid-on for a single
he takes a big forward stride and smothers in on the pitch
opens the face and runs it down to backward point
quicker delivery on off, Watson waits on the back foot and dabs it to cover point for a single
shorter on off, but slightly quicker, Hughes goes back and punches it down the ground to long on
on the pads and Watson drops it on the leg side for a single
it's flighted and almost yorker length, but Watson punches it with ease to long on
tossed up delivery outside off and Hughes, in his own weird style, mows it over midwicket, it doesn't go very far though
he comes forward and defends it solidly to the off side
only slightly shorter and Watson is quick to spot the length and cuts it hard to the off side. Vinay makes a valiant attempt, but just ends up parrying the ball to the boundary
this one is not short at all, but Watson chooses late cut, chops it to backward point
lots of loop in this one, Watson drives it firmly along the ground to long off
he gives him the charge straightaway, but the length is not there, Watson hits it straight to midwicket
it's short, but it's quick too, Watson pulls it to wide long on to bring up his fifty now. How quickly has he got there without anyone noticing..
tossed up delivery from round the stumps, gets some turn as well, better delivery, Hughes defends it off the front foot
it's shorter again and it allows Hughes to get back well in time and cut it to deep point
flatter and shorter on the stumps, Watson goes down on his knee and swipes across the line to hit it to deep midwicket
pushed through on off, Hughes calmly punches it to deep cover off the back foot
bowls fuller length on off, the batsman tries to punch it to the leg side, but inside edges it on to his pads
slightly short of length outside off, 127 kph, Hughes drags it to deep square leg with a horizontal bat shot
length delivery on off, the batsman punches it to midwicket off the front foot
he drifts down the leg side and it's duly called a wide
he stands tall and drives this length delivery on the up, but mid-off is inside the circle
short of length on off, this time Watson pushes it softly towards mid-off and calls early for a single
he had to bowl one extra ball in the this over and he chooses to go short, Hughes has no problems in putting this away to the deep midwicket boundary for four more
oh welcome! long hop is what Watson has been hitting well, so long hop it will be.. Watson sends it into the crowds through deep midwicket
goes back and punches the shorter length delivery down the ground to long on
this is better, conventional delivery on off, the batsman defends it to cover
very slow this time, allows the batsman to go back, but he punches it to cover
he is playing everything from the back foot, fails to beat the man at cover again
tossed up full and on the stumps, the batsman comes forward now and nudges it through midwicket for a single
starts off with a back of length delivery on the stumps, Hughes defends it to midwicket
length delivery, the batsman waits on the back foot and cuts it straight to the man at point
it was a length ball, but Hughes creates room by moving his front leg out and crashing it through point, where Yuvraj ends up moving to the wrong side and allowing the boundary
now he chooses his favourite, the short ball, and gets hammered with a powerful pull through deep midwicket, it just bounces inside the boundary
oh this one is nicely played, some finesse here. He waits in the crease and opens the face at the last moment to run the length delivery down to third man

he has disappeared trying to up the rate! It was a short of length delivery outside off and Watson tries to power it over long on with a flat-bat hammer hit, but ends up hitting it high rather than long, it descends at long on where Ishant takes a well-judged catch
tossed up full outside off, the batsman pushes it to midwicket off the front foot
pushed through outside off this time, the batsman punches it back to hte bowler
good bowling this by Ashwin, bowls it slower and on the stumps, the batsman pushes it down to long on
pushed through a touch quicker, the batsman goes back and defends it
cramps him for room, Hughes defends it back to the bowler again
tossed up delivery, he comes forwards and pushes it to the bowler
full and flighted outside off, Bailey eases it to long off
fires it full and wide outside off, with the amount of time Hughes has spent in the middle, he had all the time to carve it through extra cover, easy runs
oh this is so well-placed! It doesn't look pretty on the eye, but he places that short delivery sweetly in the gap at wide long on
now he comes forward and dabs it to the off side for a quick single
fulller delivery, Bailey gives the strike back to Hughes with an easy push to long off
it's a low full toss, but Hughes keeps the strike with a calm nudge to long on
quicker delivery on off, the batsman defends it off the back foot
it's slightly on the pads, Hughes clips it to backward square leg for a single
he charges down to launch it over the sight screen, but ends up slicing it over cover, some brownie points for Ashwin for beating the batsman there
quicker delivery from round the wicket, Hughes pushes it to midwicket
good accurate bowling this, the batsman comes forward and defends it back down the pitch
slightly shorter, but the batsman punches it straight to cover
he bowls length outside off, Bailey comes forward and pushes it to cover
Dhawan hits the stumps from cover, he only had one stump to aim at and they are reviewing it. It's all safe in the end. Bailey had nudged that length delivery towards cover point for a quick single
it's a bouncer and it's a decent one, Hughes aims for the pull, but it eludes the bat
slightly slower from Ishant, Hughes wanted to clip it behind square on the leg side, but has to adjust late and he drops it towards the left of the bowler for a single
it was looking like a good over till now, but then he delivers a length delivery on off, the batsman goes for a golf swing over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four
short of length just outside off, the batsman steers it to third man for a single
darts in on middle and he goes back to keep it out
chips down the track and nudges the flatter ball into the off side

No nudging this time though. 92 kph ball on off stump is met with a smart skip down the track and lofted over the bowler's head. Rohit Sharma at long-off was interested for a second or so before he watched it sail over his head
gets forward and pushes the flatter length ball through the covers for a single
he goes back in his crease and works it off his pads to deep midwicket
flights it a little better this time and gets a little turn because of it, but Hughes having played back to cut it, misses

and he finally strikes, although only just. Dhoni had to juggle it a few times to keep the ball in his gloves. A little turn outside the off stump forces the edge to be taken off the intended cut shot from Hughes. He isn't too happy with the decision though. There was a big edge though
flighted at 77kph outside the off stump and Maxwell presses forward and pushes it into the off side
sees the ball full on middle and works it off his pads to midwicket
pitched on leg and turning further, Maxwell goes down on one knee and smashes the ball over the fine leg boundary with a powerful sweep shot
scurries back leg side of the ball, pitched just outside off, as he waits for it to turn and cuts it to point
steady flat darts from Jadeja allows Bailey to get back and punch into the covers
loses his line that time as Maxwell waits for it on the back foot and flicks it through midwicket
full and flat on off stump and its the reverse this time. Short third man reluctantly jogs after it because it was struck so well he had no chance of stopping it
gets forward and pushes it down the ground for a single
tossed it up a little and Bailey is happy to work it through the covers off his front foot
full and angling in on leg stump, but Bailey produces a simple, straight bat to drive it to the right of the bowler
looked to dab that fine of third man and collect another boundary, but it was the off cutter from Ishant. There wouldn't have been enough pace on it even if Maxwell had managed to get bat on it
gets forward and nudges the full length ball straight of midwicket to pick up an easy single
another slower ball, but this has been spotted and dispatched. Made a little room for himself and launched into a full-blooded drive over the top of the bowler
a little early into the drive that time and Maxwell had to evade the ball as it came at him. Bailey was looking to drive through the covers on the up, but the ball goes down to long-on
goes back and across and just lets the ball, pitched on the shorter side, guide off the open face of his bat to third man
no turn for Jadeja this time and Maxwell works the angle to nudge to to midwicket
swept again, all along the ground and well wide of Ashwin at short fine leg. Jadeja pushed it through on leg stump but Bailey gets more than enough bat on it
returns to an on off stump line and the batsman keeps it out
length ball is pushed down the ground for a single
quicker ball from Jadeja and Maxwell catches on to it, going back and meeting it with a straight bat
goes back and cuts the length ball to deep point

lazy work from India there. Maxwell flicks the shortish ball off his pads to deep square leg but a bad throw from the deep and Dhoni was lax as well, trying to collect it with one hand and the deflection off his glove allows the batsmen to steal a second
in compensation, he doesn't even pitch the ball this time as Maxwell drills this through midwicket
chops the length ball outside off to third man to rotate strike
makes a little room to try and cut the ball, but there wasn't enough room there for him and point backpeddles to collect the ball

slopping from Ashwin, he's leaking runs in the field to add to his woeful time with the ball. Vinay's in dipper snuck low off the pitch and Maxwell was almost beaten, but his flick somehow managed to get enough bat to head straight to fine leg, where Ashwin doesn't get down low enough

dropped Length ball, angling on the pads meets a crisp pick-up shot from Maxwell. Bhuvi was coming in off the boundary and suddenle realises he has to go back and the ball bounces off his palms and into the boundary
fuller ball to which the batsman comes forward and drives to long-on
little room on offer and Maxwell makes some of his own to cut it to deep point
on middle stump and Bailey employs the slog sweep to excellent effect. The ball is lifted over midwicket boundary. 87m six as Australia are motoring along
better there as he flights the ball and Bailey comes forward and pushes through the covers
And Maxwell gets into the act. Length ball on off stump is dragged onto the leg side with a powerful short-armed pull shot
tossed up and the batsman reaches forward and pushes into the off side
turns that into a full toss with a little skip down the wicket and all he does is pierces the off side ring to collect another boundary

he shuffles across to the off side, wanting to turn the ball behind square on the leg side, but doesn't connect. Australia don't complain though as the ball runs away for four, even as the Indians appeal for lbw
the length ball outside off is dabbed to third man, as it has been easily done all innings
mows the fullish ball on leg stump through midwicket, it was an ugly slog and he wears a wry smile as he jogs through for a single

Jumps down the track, makes ample room for himself and smashes the leg cutter over the infield on the off side. And with all the men in the deep on the other side of the ground, there was no question where that ball was headed
tries the yorker, but misses it by a few inches. Maxwell jams the ball onto his pad, looking to hoick it away, but they sneak a quick single
goes for the yorker on off stump, but Maxwell has immense balance at the crease and drills the ball to the right of the man at extra cover
this time he has a lot more room to work with and he's not happy after the ball was flayed only as far as deep point
full toss on leg stump and he's very luck to get away with that. The man at fine leg is safe this time and there was even a possible chance of a run out, but Maxwell was too quick
the leg stump line continues and even with Maxwell going for a wild slog over the top of short fine leg, the ball was too wide to connect
and again. Maxwell was on his knees this time, hoping to exploit the vacant area at deep fine leg, but he would need a ten foot pole to have reached that
yorker outside the off stump and Maxwell uses the open face to steer it to deep point
yorker gone wrong again. Thigh-high full toss on off stump is heaved away wide of long-on. Australia are rampaging with these two at the crease

more lacklustre death bowling from India. After following a wide with a wide, he follows a full toss with a full toss. He slams it over midwicket this time for the same result. And its fifty for Bailey

and starts off with a useful yorker, but it is hardly threatening as Maxwell pushes it down the ground and exploits the slowness of the fielder at long on to rush back and reach his fifty off only 30 balls.
fuller length again and homing on middle and leg, but Maxwell whips it away through midwicket for a single
slog off the back foot to the length ball on off stump. Long on moves to his right to tidy up
Bhuvi attacks a line outside off stump for his best attempt at a yorker, but the batsman pushes it down the ground for a single

and the low full toss materialises in his search for a yorker. But oh dear, both batsmen are at the bowler's end. Bailey had drilled it to long-off where Raina was lurking. Maxwell saw him, waited a bit and then ecided he would steal a second off him on the throw and raced down the pitch, but Bailey had his hand up yelling No. But it was too late
length ball on middle is worked away through midwicket for a single
and he uses the straighter one, which is dabbed into the off side
charges the offspinner darted at off stump and drives it strongly down the ground to long-off
Voges the new batsman employs the reverse sweep, but the ball goes off  his thigh pad down to fine leg instead
pause and deliver only allowes Bailey that much more time to line it up and smash it over cow corner. It was the length ball on middle stump which is never any trouble in the death
ducks in low as he pushes it through outside off stump. Bailey was trying to cut but he can't get low enough connect
tossed it up well wide outside off, but Bailey sees it, comes down the track and nails it through the gap between cover and mid-off
fuller on middle, but the batsman still goes back, opens his front leg and slogs it through wide mid on
full toss outside off  and Bailey has a giant stride forward and slams it over the head of cover and with no one back behind him, it goes off for a four

and Voges turns one into two to get the big-hitting Bailey back on strike. It was a length ball on middle and he carves it through to deep midwicket. But Voges had put his head down and raced up and down the pitch well before the throw came in
on a length again and Bailey doesnt connect as well as he had done over the course of this innings, so the ball lands short of the man at long-on
oh, that was pure wristwork from Voges. It was the full toss on middle stump and he steps forward and just shovels it over the square leg boundary. That looked effortless
shortish, just a bit outside off and Voges guides it down to third man
full on leg stump is driven down the ground to wide long-on for a single off the front foot
slower bouncer on middle and leg and Bailey is completely beaten as he goes for the pull shot far too early
he gets the yorker more right than wrong that time, and Bailey digs it out well enough to reach the man at deep midwicket. Voges, with fresh legs, pulls Bailey through for the second yet another time
length ball with just enough room outside off for Bailey to slam it for a 106 m six over cow corner
much better as he goes far more fuller this time and Bailey can only mishit it down the ground to collect a single

the reverse scoop proves fatal for Voges. It was full and outside off, which meant he had to change his shot from the orthodox scoop and he doesnt get enough bat on it to beat Bhuvi at short third man
digs it into the middle of the pitch which gets the ball around head high outside off stump. Bailey tennis-forehands it down the ground to long-on and collects a couple
runs across to the off side to lift it over the keeper's head for a four, but the slower, full length ball beats him and goes tamely to the keeper
and he bowls a length ball, which enables Bailey to get underneath it and slam the ball wide of the man at deep midwicket.
gets it in the block hole on middle and Bailey digs it out as the ball goes down to long-on
he pulls the short of a length outside off to deep midwicket to give the strike back to Bailey for the last ball

carves it over point to finish the innings with a four to record the highest total in Jaipur. He went for a wide yorker, but Bailey got under it well enough to slam it almost for a six. Replays show the ball bounced just a few inches inside the rope

inn2.comm: that was quick, but it was also on the pads, flicks the thigh pads and hits the fine-leg boundary in no time.. 144 kph
oh wow! A loud appeal for lbw! That was quick, on a length, it swung back in, hit the top of front pad and flew to the keeper, the height saves Rohit
back of length on the stumps, 147kph, Rohit stands tall and defends it back down the pitch
it's on a good length and on the stumps, Rohit presses forward and punches it to mid-off
back of length delivery, pushes Rohit all the way back as he defends it towards midwicket
angles this across the right-hander, 149.7 kph, Rohit lets it go through to the keeper
he comes forward and clips the length delivery to deep backward square leg for a couple of runs
back of length this time, but it's again on the pads, Dhawan tucks it behind square on the leg side for a single
length delivery on off, Rohit comes forward and defends it down the pitch
drifts on to the pads and Rohit clips it fine on the leg side for a couple of runs to the right of fine leg
drives it smartly with a clean flow of the bat, but finds the fielder at mid-off
gets some inward swing now, it hits the inside edge, then the pads
strays with his direction this time, bowls it short and very wide outside off
hurries him with a short of length delivery, Dhawan was looking to pull it, but gets hit high on the thigh pad
goes slightly fuller this time and it's headed to the off stump, the batsman comes forward and punches it to mid off
a good short delivery this time, 153.8 kph, It's just around off stump, the batsman arches back and gets out of the way
back of length and on the body, Dhawan swivels on his heels to tuck it around to deep backward square leg for another couple
another 150 kph bolt, the batsman waits on the back foot and cuts it to the fielder at point
short delivery outside off and Dhawan is quick on it too, pulls it over midwicket with good timing for his first boundary
pitches it up to the batsman, who gets an inside edge towards midwicket as he comes forward to defend
he keeps it on a length and on off stump, the batsman has no room to play with, he defends it back to the bowler
bowls this full and wide outside off, he was possibly looking for the away swinger, but Rohit flays it over point, no movement of the feet there
pulls the length back a bit and aims it on the stumps, the batsman gets cramped for room as it comes into him, he defends it back down the pitch
he takes a forward step and chips the length delivery with a straight bat, over mid-off, one bounce and four
the bowler keeps bowling it on a length, Rohit takes the conventional approach this time, pushing it to cover
he bowls this one down the leg side, it was one of the slower ones, 131 kph
he stands tall and steers the back of length delivery on off down to third man, 152 kph
bowls from wide of the crease and on the stumps, the batsman comes forward and defends
fires this from round the stumps again, aimed at off stump, the batsman comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler
pitches this fuller and Rohit has no problems in dealing with these ones, he comes forward and caresses it through cover
again, a length delivery on off and Rohit looks for the gap at cover, but this one is closer to the fielder, who cuts it off
bowls a quick short of length delivery on the body, Rohit hops and drops it towards short midwicket
he charges down the track and punches the length delivery through extra cover, McKay's slower pace making it easier for the batsman to pick his spot

he does the same again, this time though the ball was much straighter. Dhawan uses his wrists to push it through cover, but the fielder gets a hand to it and slows it down a touch. There is also a man at deep cover now
this one is much straighter, Dhawan doesn't move around this time, waits in the crease and flicks it past midwicket
chips down the pitch and wanted to drag it over mid-on from outside off, misses it completely
back of length delivery on the off, the batsman waits and chops it towards point
this is well stopped by the short midwicket fielder! Dhawan had charged down the pitch and he played a punchy shot, but the fielder was quick to get down
starts off with a length delivery on off, Rohit comes forward and defends it solidly
back of length, 132 kph, outside off, the batsman waits in the crease and steers it to third man for a single
length delivery on off, Dhawan times his drive perfectly, but it's hit straight to the man at cover
stays in the crease and cuts the back of length delivery straight to point
no room for Dhawan to free his arms, Watson keeps it around off stump and on a back of length, the batsman can only defends it back down the pitch
the frustration gets to Dhawan as he charges down the pitch, Watson, though, keeps it angling across and the batsman is beaten
he bowls a length delivery on the pads, but the batsman is not able to take advantage, gets hit on the pads
length delivery with some width outside off, Rohit opens the face to run it down to third man
back of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
he comes forward and dabs it towards point

that has been dropped by Brad Haddin! The frustration of not scoring got into Dhawan, who swung across the line and got a massive leading edge, it went really really high, so high that Haddin ran all the way from his position, all the way to square leg to attempt the catch and he had it covered, but it just pops out...
he charges down the pitch and punches it to cover
he keeps coming down the track, this time though he gets a lot of bat on this, picks the length delivery from off and slaps it over midwicket
that seems to be his method today, he charges down again and cracks the back of length delivery past point
comes out of the pitch again and repeats the shot he played last delivery, and he picks his spot even better this time because there is a man at deep cover, who he beats comfortably
he keeps coming down the pitch, this time the ball is much straighter, so he punches it to deep extra cover
he bowls length delivery on the pads, which Rohit tucks to deep square leg with ease
he waits on the back foot and looks to pick the gap behind square on the off side, but hits it straight to backward point
he stays solid in defence, it is back of length delivery and it's is bunted on the pitch
he tries to whip it over midwicket off the front foot, but doesn't get hold of the shot at all, luckily for Rohit, there is no one behind midwicket, the ball trickles to the boundary
it's full and it's on the pads, Rohit flicks it wristily, but finds the man at midwicket
now he also uses the Dhawan method, charges down the pitch to a back of length delivery, tries to whack it towards long-on but mistimes it, again he is lucky as the ball falls behind mid on
he bowls a slower delivery, but makes the mistake of bowling it full. Rohit spots that and drives it over the infield, through cover for the second boundary this over
too straight this time from McKay, Rohit waits and clips it to the left of short fine leg for a couple more
he bowls length outside off, the batsman chops it behind point for a single
he bowls it short of length and on the stumps, Rohit goes on the back foot and tucks it behind square on the leg side for a single
he fires this one short but this one is down the leg side, Haddin does well to get to it
more extras, this one is pounded halfway down the pitch and it takes off way over the batsman and far away from the keeper
back of length delivery on the stumps, Dhawan stays in the crease and defends it to point
short delivery this time, 124 kph, Dhawan has all the time to pull it firmly to deep square leg, but there is protection in the deep now
back of length delivery on off stump, Rohit dabs it to backward point for an easy single
he walks across the stumps, but then calmly punches the length delivery to deep cover
pushed through on off, the batsman flicks it to deep square leg as the length is full
flatter and quicker on off, the batsman comes forward and defends it solidly
shorter and wide outside off, the batsman cracks it through point, off the front foot, but the fielder from deep cover runs around and cuts it off
this one is on the stumps, the batsman pushes it back to Doherty
a touch slower and on a length, Rohit waits and punches it to deep cover for a single
pushed through on off stump, the batsman dabs it to the left of Doherty and picks up a single
he comes round the wicket and floats it outside off, Dhawan reverse paddles it straight to short third man
he comes forward and punches it back to the bowler
fuller and wider this time, he drives it to deep extra cover for a couple of runs
this one is straighter and the batsman eases it to long off for a single
pushed through on the middle and leg line, Rohit dabs it to the right of midwicket and calls for a quick single
full and flighted on the middle, the batsman flicks it straight to short fine
full and flighted on the middle, the batsman drives it past the non-striker for an easy single
keeps it full and tosses it up too, the batsman drives it but finds the man at cover point

is that all over? After tossing up a couple of deliveries, Doherty fires it flat and wide outside off, Dhawan was already pushing way forward and he tries to slap the delivery through off, but is beaten. Haddin does well to flick the bails off in a flash. He drags the toe out, but pushes it back. But is it out? Very hard to tell. It's one of those cases when a frame goes missing. It's on the line is my impression, and that should be out, but the third umpire has said it's not out. Can't really complain with that either..As I said, it was about the missing frame and batsman gets lucky here
pushed through on off stump, the batsman pushes it through midwicket for a single
he stays in the crease and punches the length delivery to long off for a single
flatter and on off stump, the batsman goes on the back foot and punches it to wide long on for a single
keeps it slow and wide outside off, the batsman stretches forward but can't time it at all
length delivery outside off, still no timing as he pushes it to off
fuller this time, he comes forward and drives it down to long off
some hesitation between the batsmen as Rohit looks for a run at point, but he is sent back in time
this one is on the pads and Rohit tucks it behind square for a quick single
he keeps the pace slow and the batsman has to wait for the delivery, then defend it back
tosses it up, inviting Rohit to drive and he does so but cover is on hand to collect the ball
waits for the ball to come to him as he goes deep in the crease and late cuts it to short third man and gets a single
tucks it away behind square on the leg side as Doherty bowls a fullish length
flighted on off stump and he leans forward to block it down the pitch
darts it in at over 90kph, shorter too but its dead on middle which means the batsman has to push it back to the bowler
another solid forward defensive to meet a nicely flighted delivery on the stumps to end the over
and he beats the bat as Rohit goes searching outside his off stump. Held it back just a tad and the ball went on with the angle
this time he nails it. Comes down the track having seen there is no turn for Maxwell and lifts it over long-on
quicker delivery on middle is the response as Rohit gets behind and defends
fuller on middle and Rohit uses his wrists to push it down the ground to long-on
fuller on middle and Dhawan steps forward to keep bat and pad together in defence
dabs the shortish ball outside off to point and looks for a single, but it isn't there
angled down the pads and with the non-existant spin, all Rohit needed to do was get a feather to it and the fielder and deep fine leg, despite a valiant effort, can't get the better of that
on a length on middle and tucked away behind square for a single
tossed up at 90kph and Rohit watchfully defends back to the bowler off his front foot
holds this one back as Rohit chips down the track, but he doesn't indulge in a big shot having realised he has not reached the pitch. Blocks it back down the pitch
Gets to the pitch of that after chipping down the track and drives to long-off to get a single
taken on the full as this one is angled across him, but it is hit straight to cover
pitches wide outside leg stump and turns further wide. The keeper had no chance and India get a few bonus runs
his flight is on line this time, as he makes Rohit step forward and defend
goes back and punches it through the covers. The batsmen try looking for two, but it isnt there
goes deep in his crease and guides the shortish ball outside off to point
on and around the off stump and a goodish length as Rohit stays leg side of it and pushes the ball through the covers
a little bit of innovation there as he goes down the reverse sweep, but finds point in the way

a lovely late cut from Dhawan takes him to his fifty. It was just a tad short, but Dhawan watched it right onto his bat and met it at the perfect time to push it all the way to the boundary at third man
and now he indulges in his favourite cover drive. Tossed up from Doherty, but it was still quick at 95 kph. Long stride forward almost brings him to the pitch and he beats the man at extra cover
holds it back as he aims for middle stump, but Dhawan punches it down the ground. Midwicket comes around to do some smart clean up
he comes down the track and drills it straight to long-on with a little bit of flourish
bowls it a little too straight and Dhawan is happy to whip it off his knee-roll. Deep square leg has a bit of work to do but he is up for it
shimmies down the wicket, staying leg side of the back of a length ball and slaps it through point for deep third man to collect
he's been conscious of keeping the length full and an elegant-looking drive from Rohit cannot pierce the off side field
nice and full on middle which forces the batsman to play down the ground and only for a single
a very small bit of in dip there, but Dhawan had reached the pitch of it with some excellent footwork and drills it through the man at cover to find the boundary
that was slower, 112 kph from Faulkner, and Dhawan is beaten as his intended flick does not connect and dribbles away from his pad
flighted outside off and Rohit steps smartly forward and pushes to cover
and holds this one back, but is still around the off stump. Rohit stands up tall and punches it to long-off
fuller on leg stump and Dhawan presents a straight bat as he finds the man at long-on
chipped over the top of the off side ring as Doherty keeps it full. Long-off gets some work to do
he advances, but Doherty saw him and fired it shorter and quicker. Dhawan adjusts, punching it down to long-off again
sweep shot to profitable results. he goes across on the off side to fetch it and gets enough bat on it to travel to the fine leg boundary

one of those agricultural shots we have become accustomed to in the T20 era. It was a length ball with a little room outside off and Dhawan, gets on his front foot, and mauls it over short midwicket's head
And this one was fuller, but it goes through the same regiom Dhawan lofts it wide of short midwicket this time with a powerful drive
skips down the track, but Faulker drops it short. He goes for the cut but the ball bounces over his edge.
he continues his excursions outside the crease, this time meeting the length ball with a slap through the covers
angles into his pads and Rohit is happy to flick it through midwicket to return the strike to Dhawan
on the shorter side, with a little room outside off allows Dhawan to carve it through point. There is a sweeper cover though
and he beats him first up. Dhawan was stuck in the crease as he looked to pull the ball, which was a little too full to attempt a horizontal bat shot and the ball sails over the middle stump

this one was short enough and Dhawan climbs into it. Doesnt bother keeping it down because he knows there is no one in the in-field to stop that shot, which goes all the way to the square leg boundary
a little bit of inward movement, which Dhawan negotiates with soft hands as he defends the ball. His search for a quick single is denied after Rohit saw Johnson making a beeline for the ball
slower short ball, but only just at 130 kph. Dhawan was too early into his pull shot as the ball ducks beneath his bat and goes through to Haddin
The short-ball ploy, ironically, is not working on a faster pitch. Comes nicely on to his bat as he swivels on the crease and pulls the ball coming in just above hip high behind square
that yorker was speared in on leg stump. Dhawan hoped to flick it fine, but the ball dips in a little more to beat the bat and hit his pads and sneak off towards fine leg
oh, imperious. Dhawan has found rich results when skipping down the track and this time he simply flays one to the left of the man at cover and the ball slams into the advertising boards in a flash
and when they explore the middle of the pitch, Dhawan, rocks his weight back and punishes it dead square for another boundary
that one dips a little low, but Dhawan still manages to pull it quite strongly to midwicket with the litte room available outside off
another crisp stroke, but the square drive to the length ball outside off finds point
on the shorter side again and Dhawan is happy to dab it into the off side and retain strike
full and homing in on middle stump. Dhawan's straight drive doesnt come off quite so well as the bat turns in his hand to deprive him of any timing on it
pitches it right up on off stump and Dhawan doesnt make any attempt to cover the line as he drills it to cover off the front foot
and there's the Mitchell Johnson short ball, and Dhawan's flash outside the off stump goes on the bounce to third man
shorter ball again and Rohit tries to steer it to third man for a single, but can;t get it fine enough
this time he does as Johnson looks to rattle him with short stuff from around the wicket. It isn't working though as Rohit did not look rushed in any way as he guided the ball to third man
its the swivel-pull from Dhawan again as he rolls his wrists on this one to make sure it stays down the ground to deep square leg

he's nicked it. And Dhawan admonishes himself as he walks off, five short of a century. James Faulkner though is over the moon. It was a good length ball outside off and Dhawan went for his cover drive, but this time his edges is taken instead of the middle

a handsome drive to start off with as he gets to the pitch of that full length ball outside off. There was ample timing there, but it wasn't placed quite so well. The fielder at cover fumbles allowing a single
on a length around the off stump and Rohit covers the line to defend it
full and outside off, Rohit gets nicely forward and opens the face of the bat to steer it to sweeper cover
uses the little room on offer and dabs the back of a length ball down to deep third man to collect another single
presses on the front foot and drives it down the ground to mid-off
and he is treated to a bouncer first up, but Kohli was waiting for that as he stays back and pulls it down into the ground through midwicket
opens the face when he meets the good length ball outside off stump to collect another run through third man
This one didn't have as much room, but Kohli allowed it to reach him as he let it ride off the open face through to third man
he's almost on one knee as he meets the ball well wide of off stump. The ball goes fine of point and deep third man is a very busy fielder
good length ball, and quick too - 153kph - angling in on middle to which Kohli presents a straight bat
gets a strong stride forward and drills the square drive to point off a fuller delivery
uses the angle from aroudn the wicket to tuck him up as Rohit chops the back of a length ball into the off side
the fuller length allows Rohit to punch it down the ground off the front foot and get off strike. He's been doing that quite well this innings
steps down the pitch and whips it between midwicket and mid-on. It was in the air, but it was timed and placed well enough to give India another four
this time he holds the length back and Kohli responds to it but dabbing it off the back foot to point
a little in dip from the bowler, but Kohli rides that well, staying back in his crease and opening the face
down the track again and this time he gets six for it. While Fualkner goes for a tumble, Kohli stands and admires the shot as the full length ball aimed outside off sails over the long-off fence
crouches on one knee to sweep the ball, full and angled into middle, to the man at fine leg
charges the spinner too, but he his drive though strong is hit straight back to the bowler

some magic from Maxwell on the extra cover fence. First there was some magic from Kohli's wrists as he slammed the ball over the cover. Maxwell runs around from long-off and extends his hand full stretch to push the ball back in play
swift and flat whicih Rohit negotiates with a punch down to long-on

This time he goes over the deep fielder too. And much straighter. Doherty isn't flighting the ball too much, but Kohli reaches to the pitch as he forays down the track and lifts it powerfully over the top
gets his front foot across to the off side to work the fullish ball through square leg
slower ball to start off a new spell as Kohli comes down the track and adjusts his stroke to dab it square on the off side
another slower one - 106kph - and Rohit was far too early on the pull shot, as he gets an under edge and the ball bounces tamely at his feet

he's down. He's slapped that miles over midwicket and has gone down immediately with cramp on his right hamstring. This was not slower, but McKay persisted with the shortish length. Rohit was waiting for it and as he was admiring the shot, he grimaces, clutches his right hammie and goes down as Kohli rushes up to help from the non-striker's end
goo length on middle to which he comes forward and hopes to work it into the on side, but doesn't get enough wrist into the stroke as McKay runs around to collect it
pushed down the ground to long-on as McKay sticks to a much better, fuller length
off cutter gets smashed. Kohli has been violent when he gets down the track. He stays leg side of the ball to get all the leverage he needs to punish it over the top of long-off
cramps him up, but Rohit adjusts well, chopping the ball square on the off side with soft hands and rushing off to collect a single
dismissed it. It was dragged down short and Kohli stays solid at the crease and slams it well over the midwicket fence, which Watson watches stunned

looks for a dab through third man as Watson bowls back of a length on middle. There seemed to be some sort of noise and the Australians appeal, but the umpire is unmoved. Haddin put on a delayed appeal though
gets forward to meet the full length ball with a lovely, straight bat
another foray down the track and another imperious four. Made a little room for himself as he came down and just flays this through the covers with a touch of disdain
and following the boundary, he waits for the ball to come it him and uses the tiny bit of room on it to dab it to third man and retain strike
they are racing between the wickets, even Rohit who is showing no signs of cramp now and the little flick through midwicket off a good length ball gets two runs
another magnificent strike over cover and you guessed it, he was down the track again. It was on a length outside off and Kohli has no trouble lofting it over the top of cover for a one bounce four
and that seems the only way to tether him. McKay bowls fullish on middle to which Kohli pushes down the ground to collect a single
explores the off stump corridor against Rohit though, with a good length ball which is dabbed to  the man at point
cuts it to cover as McKay holds it at a shortish length outside off stump

six, off only one hand. He did everything wrong there, but still got the maximum result. He was early into the shot, he hadn't moved toward the ball, though he did move forward. But somehow the ball hit the middle of the bat and sailed over point
he  charges him again, but having been cramped for foot just defended
stays back  to the flatter ball and whips it wide of the man at long-on to collect a single
fifty to Kohli off only 27 balls as he nudges the full ball on his pads through midwicket.
fuller and angled across the batsman who presses forward and blocks it down the ground for an easy single
If he gets down the track, Australia better watch out. Reaches the pitch effortlessly and powers it straight over the top to pepper the long-off boundary
shorter and pitched outside leg, but the ball turns across the right-hander, who waits for it on the back foot and pushes it back down the pitch
back-of-the-hand slower ball goes awry as the batsman watches it cross him well past the wide line on the off side
camps on the back foot as he lets the ball run off his bat to third man
another full, slower ball, which the batsman drags from outside off stump through midwicket

inside edge foils that lbw appeal, but the bowler had the upper hand there, after a very long time in this match. It seemed ti skid off the pitch, catching Rohit off guard who was looking to play a lazy defensive stroke off the back foot
nothing unconvincing about that. Ample room outside off, short again and Rohit, stayed back in his crease and flayed it over the top of cover
shortish and just a small bit of room which enables him to nudge to backward point and collect a single
charges the bowler and whips the ball through midwicket to get a single and retain strike
angles it across the right-hander who is happy to let the good length ball go to the keeper
this time he is on the pads and Kohli's wrists are too strong for that ball to go anywhere other than to the boundary. Whips it powerfully past short fine leg
and another one, this time he shovels the ball through the gape between midwicket and the man at long-on. It was a length ball and duly punished
slower ball from Johnson, which doesn't post too much problem as he tucks it in front of midwicket
full and angled at the non-existant slips, and Rohit leans into a lazily elegant drive to cover
tight in defense as well as Johnson keeps the ball full and on off stump
he charges down the pitch, makes it a yorker, but jams it out to midwicket
he keeps charging out, this time he takes the ball on half-volley and smashes it to long on, for a single
fuller delivery wide outside off and Rohit creams it through extra cover. Where are the fielders! No extra cover, no one in the deep. That's 100 of this stand too
keeps it full and wide outside off, Rohit slices it straight to point this time
fuller again and it's wide too, Rohit slices this time and beats point and once he has done that, there is no one in the deep! Where are the fielders?
full and on the middle, Rohit moves to 99 with a soft push to mid-on
bowls it short of length on the body, Rohit dabs it to the off side, but there are lot of fielders close by
full and aimed on the base of offstump, Rohit digs it out towards point
he comes forward and drives it firmly through cover point, there was no one in the deep and he is is chuffed, isn't he! It's his first century as an opener and his third overall.
now MJ slips it down the leg side and that's bonus runs
gets this one to come in sharply from round the wicket, and Rohit gets an inside edge on to his pads, the bowler thinks about asking for an lbw, but realises there was a loud noise
aims for a yorker, it's officially the bad Mitch today, he sprays it wide down the leg side and Haddin could do nothing to stop that
fuller length delivery on the stumps, now Kohli is saved by the inside edge, it hits his pads and rolls towards gully
length delivery on the stumps, Rohit dabs it to the right of midwicket for a single
back of length delivery on off, Rohit punches it to the off side, but as far as cover
back of length delivery on the body, slightly slower that usual, the batsman punches it down to long off for a single
oh he uses his wrists brilliantly! He charged down the pitch and whips it to deep midwicket where there is a fielder present
slower delivery on off, Rohit waits and chops it to backward point for a single
his bat face gets closed as he ends up placing this down to long on, he was aiming for long off with this
one bounce, second bounce and it's four again! It was fuller delivery on the middle stump line and Rohit chipped it in the air, but he opened the face slightly to place it over extra cover
oh this one is brutally cracked through cover! It was hurled at 90 mph, it went through cover at double the speed, really really brutal cover drive
back of the length and fired down the leg side, from wide of the crease. MJ says it flicked the pads, but the umpire doesn't agree
length delivery on off, Kohli punches it to wide long off for an easy single
aims for the yorker, and it's marginally outside off, but Rohit, with all the time in the world, squeezes it through point
slightly slower delivery, and it's full too. Rohit spot it and calmly defends it to point
fuller again outside off, Rohit now powers it over extra cover with an inside out hit, one bounce and four..
attempts a yorker, it ends up being a low full toss and Rohit doesn't do anything more than show it the gap at wide mid-off.. Carnage
it doesn't matter which angle Doherty is going to come from, Kohli jumps out of the crease and drives it over extra cover with a beautifully placed inside out shot
comes out of the pitch again, but this time slaps it firmly down to long on
against all odds, Rohit defends this tossed up delivery calmly
more flight this time, Rohit leans forward and pushes it to cover
more solid defence from Rohit, he is no hurry
and he is not keen to take a run at all, that is fourth dot ball in the over as Rohit defends it to off
he comes down the pitch and pushes the full delivery to long on for a single
flighted on the pads, easily driven to midwicket with a wristy flick
comes down the pitch, Maxwell saw him and bowled it quick, but it doesn't matter because Kohli launches it over cow corner with ease
and this time he goes over the infield on the off side, more of a slice, but there is no protection in the deep. Four more.. Geeeez
comes down the pitch and punches the quicker delivery down the ground to long off
tossed up delivery, it's driven to extra cover for a quick single
he takes a forward step and eases it to long off for a single
comes down the pitch, but the bowler pulls the length back and Kohli has to defend
clears his front leg out and smashes the tossed up delivery from leg stump to over cow corner
he cuts this straight to point, smiles everywhere..
he gets the fastest ODI century by an Indian, the seventh fastest ever, with a delicate dab to point. the whole ground erupts, Kohli's teammates erupt.It's his 16th 100 as well
he drives this one through cover for a single
where are the fielders! this was a mere push through cover and there is no one in the deep, four more.. This is wrong, so wrong
well, what can i say! It's a low full toss and it's smashed with the ease of driving a bicycle on an airstrip.. i don't know what to say really.. this is over the cow corner
another low full toss on the pads, and this is flicked to the boundary again.. Geez... how many more to score? Oh, this is over! Six and a half overs to spare. I am gobsmacked
